text:
Running "make test", testdso will fail.
Actually the DSO code works well, it's just a problem of the testdso because it cannot find mod_test.dll
After compiling with mingw and autotools, this file can be found in .libs/mod_test.dll, but testdso searches it into TESTBINPATH "mod_test.dll".
I did a first experiment, changing MOD_NAME to ".libs/mod_test.dll" and I verified that the test have been passed successfully.
The final solution relies on the definitions of these macros.
creator: carlo.bramix@libero.it
carlo.bramix@libero.it
text: I just verified that testflock and testoc failed for the same reason, related to TESTBINPATH definition.

creator: trawick@apache.org
text:
This is basically what is needed (apr_hints.m4):

     *mingw*)
+        APR_ADDTO(INTERNAL_CPPFLAGS, -DBINPATH=$apr_builddir/test/.libs)

I also had to change testproc.c as it was using TESTBINPATH in an unexpected way:

rv = apr_proc_create(&newproc, "../" TESTBINPATH "proc_child" EXTENSION, ...

Removing the "../" works for me, but I haven't looked at that in detail.
Merged to 1.5.x branch for future apr 1.5.0
creator: trawick@apache.org
